content: as many as you fancy cast on 30 sts knit 2 row the hands are worked in short row on the first 5 stitches only there is no need to wrap the stitches when turning ridge 1 k4 turn k4 ridge 2 k3 turn k3 ridge 3 k4 turn k4 ridge 4 k5 turn k5 cast off all 30 sts if you cast off quite tightly it will encourage the arms to curl sew the arms to the body mouth and eyes the mouth is knitted with light coloured yarn of a thinner weight than that used for the monster using the long tail method cast on 12 sts cast off the loose cast off will make the mouth curve into a smile sew the mouth to the monster s face sew on small black beads for eyes if the monster is for a small child you might like to embroider the eyes instead the brown handspun was really rough and lumpy so i embroidered flowers all over the finished monster and now he s my favourite abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit m1 make 1 by lifting the thread before the next stitch and knitting into the back of it k2tog knit two stitches together ssk slip 2 stitches knitwise or knitwise followed by purlwise one at a time insert tip of left needle into stitches from above put yarn round right needle and knit both stitches together kf&b knit into the front and back of the stitch © frankie brown 2012 my patterns are for personal use only and should not be used to knit items for sale
